DataElement.preferredName: Common Toxicity Criteria Adverse Event Depressed Level Of Consciousness Most Severe Level Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the common toxicity criteria adverse event depressed level of consciousness most severe level.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Common Toxicity Criteria Adverse Event Depressed Level Of Consciousness
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standard terminology developed to report adverse events occurring in cancer clinical trials.  Common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) are used in study adverse event summaries and Investigational New Drug reports to the Food and Drug Administration.  The CTCAE contain a grading scale for each adverse event term representing the severity of the event._A neurologic state characterized by decreased ability to perceive and respond.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standard terminology developed to report adverse events occurring in cancer clinical trials.  Common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) are used in study adverse event summaries and Investigational New Drug reports to the Food and Drug Administration.  The CTCAE contain a grading scale for each adverse event term representing the severity of the event.

Concepts.longName: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events
Concepts.definition: A standard terminology developed to report adverse events occurring in cancer clinical trials.  Common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) are used in study adverse event summaries and Investigational New Drug reports to the Food and Drug Administration.  The CTCAE contain a grading scale for each adverse event term representing the severity of the event.

Property.preferredDefinition: A neurologic state characterized by decreased ability to perceive and respond.

Concepts.definition: A neurologic state characterized by decreased ability to perceive and respond.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Depressed Level Of Consciousness Most Severe Level Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A neurologic state characterized by decreased ability to perceive and respond._Greatest in amount, extent, or degree; constituting a majority._Intensely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent._A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

PermissibleValues.value: Patient unarousable or requires vigorous or repetitive tactile stimuli to arouse; stupor or coma
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Requirement Force Or Repeat Touch Stimulus Lethargic Or Coma Negation Alert

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Requirement Force Or Repeat Touch Stimulus Lethargic Or Coma Negation Alert
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.: The influence that produces a change in a physical quantity; physical energy or intensity.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Make or do or perform again.: The faculty of touch, the sensation produced by pressure receptors in the skin.: An environmental event, agent, act, or influence that can be detected by a receptor in the body and will invariably produce a reaction in a living organism, e.g. change in the behavior, functional or trophic reaction.: Characterized by a lack of vitality or energy.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: A state of profound unconsciousness associated with markedly depressed cerebral activity. Causes include central nervous system damage, intoxication, and metabolic abnormalities.: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: Condition of heightened watchfulness or preparation for action.

Concepts.definition: Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.
The influence that produces a change in a physical quantity; physical energy or intensity.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Make or do or perform again.
The faculty of touch, the sensation produced by pressure receptors in the skin.

An environmental event, agent, act, or influence that can be detected by a receptor in the body and will invariably produce a reaction in a living organism, e.g. change in the behavior, functional or trophic reaction.
Characterized by a lack of vitality or energy.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A state of profound unconsciousness associated with markedly depressed cerebral activity. Causes include central nervous system damage, intoxication, and metabolic abnormalities.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Condition of heightened watchfulness or preparation for action.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not accompanied by another or others; exclusive of anyone or anything else.: The faculty of touch, the sensation produced by pressure receptors in the skin.: An environmental event, agent, act, or influence that can be detected by a receptor in the body and will invariably produce a reaction in a living organism, e.g. change in the behavior, functional or trophic reaction.: To wake up or become awake.

Concepts.definition: Not accompanied by another or others; exclusive of anyone or anything else.

An environmental event, agent, act, or influence that can be detected by a receptor in the body and will invariably produce a reaction in a living organism, e.g. change in the behavior, functional or trophic reaction.
To wake up or become awake.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Happening or arising without apparent external cause.: To wake up or become awake.

Concepts.definition: Happening or arising without apparent external cause.
To wake up or become awake.
